intro: Clematis urticifolia var. carnea, commonly known as the velvetleaf clematis, is a vigorous climbing vine native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are often tinged with red or purple, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its aggressive growth habit, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and landscapes.
